Risks And Rewards From Hospital Premium Subsidies

Law360, New York (June 24, 2014, 10:37 AM ET) -- The seemingly contrary determinations and messaging transmitted from the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding whether entities can contribute to help pay premiums for enrollees needing to purchase insurance coverage on the new health insurance exchange marketplaces established under the Affordable Care Act has created a maze of confusion for the hospital industry.

article_metadata.description: The direct payment of premiums or cost sharing by hospitals or hospital-affiliated foundations has not been explicitly approved by either the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services or the Internal Revenue Service. To the contrary, the conditions of the foundation exception seem to anticipate that targeted payment to existing patients was intentionally excluded from the stated exception, say Susan Harris and Christopher Swift of BakerHostetler LLP.
